subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wp|lang=ja}} {{wp|Samurai}}
{{ja-kanjitab|さむらい|yomi=k}} {{IPAfont|⟨sa morapi1⟩}} → {{IPAchar|/saburapi/}} → {{IPAchar|/saburafi/}} → {{IPAchar|/samurawi/}} → {{IPAchar|/samurai/}} Sound shift from ''saburai'' (see below), itself the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei|pos=stem or continuative form}} of classical verb {{m|ja|侍ふ|tr=saburafu||to [[serve]]|pos=modern ''saburau''}}, ultimately derived from {{m|ja|さ|tr=sa-||pos=prefix meaning "[[early]]"}} + {{m|ja|守らふ|tr=morafu||to [[keep watch]]|pos=modern ''morau''}}. The shift from ''saburaf-'' → ''samuraf-'' is due to the development of the {{m|ja|女性語|tr=josei-go||{{w|Gender differences in spoken Japanese|women's language}}}} in {{w|Middle Japanese}}, expected from {{m|ja|候|tr=sōrō||[[service]]|pos=classical ''saurafu''}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|さむらい|hhira=さむらひ}}

# {{lb|ja|historical|sort=さむらい}} a [[warrior]] [[class]] in [[medieval]] and pre-[[modern]] Japan; [[samurai]]
#: {{synonyms|ja|武士|tr=bushi}}
# one who [[serve]]s [[nearby]]:
## a [[servant]]
## a [[retainer]]
# {{short for|lang=ja|侍所|tr=samurai-dokoro|nodot=1}}: the Board of Retainers in the {{w|Kamakura period|Kamakura}} and {{w|Muromachi period|Muromachi}} periods.
# an [[above]]-[[average]] [[person]]
